Text: In my opinion Iso-Parcour make the best winter boots money can buy. The neoprene lining insulates the feet against extreme cold (-20!!!) You only need to wear thin stockings or socks - that way you feel as if you are walking barefoot through the snow! Long walks in snow are no problem with these boots. Two small criticisms: the price is really steep and you can really only wear these boots in minus temps. At +10 these boots are far too heavy and hot.

They were also just a little too high, pushing my toes forward. On the design frontI gave them 4 stars as they are a very dark green, almost black and I would have preferred a more vibrant green. As I have said though, these are all personal problems and for someone else they would be lovely!

Text:
I like this shirt very much - so much so, in fact, that I have now bought it in both colours.  It is a 'tailored' fit, so quite snug for the size indication.  That suits me, but don't be tempted to scale down a size.

The quality seems very good - as it should be for this price -  and I particularly like the extra buttons towards the top.  These mean it is easy to have the collar open by just the right amount - no more big decisions about whether to undo one button, or two.

Text: I'm currently marathon training and have been wearing Nike Pegasus, but felt I needed a bit more cushioning and comfort, so after some research I opted for the Vomero10, it's the best decision for a neutral runner. Cautiously wore them for the first time to do an easy paced 6 mile run without any problems, next run was 15 miles and again no rubbing or chaffing. I've also worn them since for speed sessions and they're fine. There's a definite difference between Pegasus and Vomero; Vomero being more cushioned. Incidentally I wear customised insole orthotics in my running shoes, these shoes come with an OK cushioned insole which would be OK for a little while but if you're a serious runner orthotics are the way to go. They're true to size, toe box is slightly more spacious than Pegasus (I'm a tiny 2.5 UK and find it problematic finding show to fit) Also, love the colour, especially the lovely bright orange laces. Now looking forward to running my marathon in comfort!
Title: Excellent cushioned running shoe

Text:
Was looking specifically for a warm winter boot to wear in snowy/wet climate and took a gamble on the Lowa OSLO GTX. As soon as I unboxed them I could see the quality in the build and materials used. Super warm too, with fleecy/fur lining all the way through the boot. Even the foot pads are insulated on the underside. True to fit and slightly wider comfort width. A fantastic boot that oozes style and has passed the deep puddles and light snow test with flying colours!

Would recommend to anyone looking for a warm rugged outdoor mid boot for snowy climates.
Title: BUY THIS BOOT!

Text:
I normally buy cheap, and these are not. They appear to be worth the money. The soles have deep tread pattern and are tough, not showing any marks after about 30 miles mixed trekking.
The fit is excellent, unusually adaptive to my narrow feet.  This is due to the flexible upper and long lacing pattern right down the top surface. I nearly threw the extra, optional, insoles beacause they were packed in an unmarked white box which looked like a spacer. They are a good idea, but I didn't need them as the boot accommodated well to my foot. The construction of the boot looks robust, with the top lacing anchorage made of steel tied back to the heel, and various  re-inforcement strips and mouldings . The boot is light , has been completely waterproof. It's easy to put on and take of provided that the laces are released down the foot.   
It was comfortable immediately, and if it wears as well at it promises, it will be my standard footwear.
Title: Different and better

Text: I've been looking for a leather tote bag for shopping for a while and I'm very pleased with this one.  It is a really good size and, unlike many similar large leather bags, is properly finished around the edges so I know that it won't look tatty or go baggy at the top.  I prefer a bag which is long rather than wide as I think it is better in a crowded shop.  The only thing which it is some sort of closure at the top, for safety.  I didn't realise that it was not real leather when I bought it and it looks absolutely fine, though I think the price is high for faux leather.
Title: Nice looking bag, just the right size to hold shopping

Text:
I have a lot of Osprey rucksacks as they are, in my view, the best make of rucksack.  This lightweight wheeled suitcase is no different, lots of zipped compartments and extras to stow your magazines, front pocket for carrying your airline tickets etc whilst around the airport.  It looks small when you look at it, but it's like a blackhole in the amount you can actually fit into it & the compression straps are helpful.  I also have the osprey large rucksack that zips up the harness which I use for backpacking around & I use the airporter bag which I stash my rucksack in & i'll use this too to keep this bag protected (I have seen how baggage handlers treat suitcases).
Really impressed with this bag as I am with all Osprey kit (& no I don't work for them!).
Title: Great piece of kit

Text:
The most comfortable shoes on the market. The boost sole is squishy under foot, soft to stand on all day & the boost technology gives an everlasting spring to each step. There quite a good degree of heel to toe angle. There is some arch support which is fine for me but if you are looking for more arch support then the ultra boost ST models might be better. The sole is made from continental so traction is superior in all weather. The insoles are removable and do have an nmd type covering of the boost if you wish to remove them. All ultra boosts come with a torsion plate built into the sole, this helps with foot stability and arch stability. The upper is made from primeknit material, its super stretchy so there is no restriction to you feet at all, it has a sock like feel when the shoes are on feet, so much so you can forget you are wearing shoes! It is breathable but I do find my feet still get fairly hot inside these shoes. 
The colour of this shoe is a mix between blue and grey, and it has black peppered in throughout the primeknit with a black heel cap, black continental sole and a semi translucent cage. It is a stunning shoe, so much so I bought two pairs. 
Sizing - go true to size, do not size up as the primeknit upper is so stretchy the shoe will be too big. I'm a UK 8.5 in women's and men's and the shoes fit perfectly, I can even fit an 8 quite happily due to the stretchy materials. Hope this helps
Title: The worlds most comfortable shoe!!

Text: These shoes look great but unfortunately they are extremely painful when worn. After only 45 mins the right shoe had rubbed so much, a layer of skin the size of a penny had been ripped off my upper heel - very painful! I say 45 mins but it was actually less time to do the damage as I spent approximately 25 mins sat down on the train. Had my other heel not been protected by a plaster (from a different painful experience with a different pair of shoes) then no doubt I would have both heels missing a layer of skin. I'm sorry but I cannot leave a positive review for an item that has caused me so much pain.
Title: Nice shoe but a painful item

Text: Very nice pair of minimalist track suit trousers by Reebok. I always like their stuff, which is perfect for the gym and casualwear, is usually very high quality, and is not overtly branded such that you end up looking like an unpaid advertising hoarding (are you listening Adidas?!). I particularly like how light these trousers are as they don't have an inner lining. I also like their cut which is neither too baggy or too tight. My only criticism is that there are no sealable pockets, although the main pockets are very deep and one of them also has a small coin pocket. One important point of advice is that I'm 6 feet tall and around 83 kgs and found that M size fitted me perfectly. Thus I reckon L would be suitable for a strapping heavyweight boxer, and XL would have (had) Pavarotti's name sewn into it. No problems with ordering from Zalando which has an excellent Reebok range - in my opinion better than Reebok's website itself -  and the price was fair, and delivery was without any criticism. Recommended all round.
Title: Mr Contented

Text: These are really comfortable shoes but the heels act like suction cups on hard flooring surfaces - laminate, hardwood, linoleum, some concrete is enough for the heel to adhere and literally pull the shoe off your foot. Text: These boots were a birthday present from my husband (chosen by me of course). They are very comfortable and I was able to do a day's shopping in town without the usual aching feet.  They are on the pricey side but I was happy to pay for a product which was exactly what I wanted.

Text:
They're so light that I had to double check my backpack to reasure myself I'd actually packed them in there, lol. They also seem to take up much less bag room than my current, different brand, running shoes - I've already added some Reebok Sublite Duos to my wishlist to replace those with ;)
They look smarter than any other training shoe I've ever owned.
Very unique looking, seemingly very well constructed & I opted for the black & gravel ones which I was complimented on by my fellow crossfitters.
Although the abnormally wide toe area gave me cause for concern about stability & safety, after trailing them at my gym's Insanity circuit training class, all my doubts vanished. They're very safe, in my opinion & a very well thought out design & construction
The sole gripped the room's wooden floor excellently.
My feet stayed cool throughout my high intensity, 45 minute, workout, which made such a fantastic difference, improving both my performance & enjoyment of the class.
Well done Reebok for daring to be different & innovative!
Title: Weird, Wonderful & Innovative

Text: Zalando provides the most fantastic service!  I bought these AirStep boots in a size smaller than usual, having originally bought a pair in my usual size and finding them much too big.  The smaller size fitted well when I put them on, though the right boot was looser around the ankle than the left.  After one day's wear, however, both boots have 'given' so much that they are uncomfortably loose and my feet slide around in them.  The heels are not flat on the floor, so they rock back to front.  Irritating and a great disappointment, as they are stylish and are well-made.  Shame that the fit is so poor.  Very expensive mistake!  I would not recommend, as I consider them very poor value for money.

Was initially concerned about the material it was made of and whether it would be tight-fitting or not. I needn't have worried! Text: This is a well-made jacket that will keep you comfortable and warm over winter.  It has a pleasing weight and soft, snug padding; the massive, cosy hood sits well on your head and will protect your face from all weathers.  There are pockets everywhere and the high quality knitted cuffs and waistband fit well.  I love this new and slightly unusual colourway, which is a really lustrous, deep green shade, with the constrasting bright orange lining popping out.  The faux fur trim is, unusually for Alpha, a black, silver and white colour rather than the usual golden brown.
Title: A pleasing twist on a classic design.

Text:
I have bought Nudie Jeans twice in my life. First time was in a store in Malmö. The pair lasted me less than a year, as it ripped beyond repair when I fell one day.
Second time was via Zalando Lounge. They fit great, denim felt nice and sturdy. But after just a few months the fabric was thinning and I got a hole at the cuff of the leg. I've had them for less than six months now and both knees ripped as I just sat down to close my suitcase (note that I do nothing crazy in them, just walk around and sit on my butt). So I'm very disappointed with this brand. The fit is awesome but the quality is not worth the price at all. I have bought jeans in the past that were cheaper but lasted me longer than these.
Title: Great fit, but awful quality

Text: I love the design of these boots but upon receiving them was disappointed.  They come up larger than a 5 - more like a 5.5 and the soles are white! They were quite comfortable on, but the design of heel is not stable so even though not that high you just go over side ways in them.  Not supportive to the ankle at all and therefore not actually great design.  I think these are substandard stock but are not being advertised as such.

Text: first of all the item ordered arrived in the time they said it would, but it was the wrong size. dont order from these people if you want to avoid hassle as their returns policy is a joke. as i dont have a printer i have to wait a week for the return slip to arrive and then wait for the money to be returned before i can then re-order the  item i ordered in the first place.in this day and age this type of service is not good enough!.and when i rang the call centre the guy on the phone hung up on me .this to is a terrible way to deal with a customer. so i cant review the item fully but can rewiew the rubbish way they deal with customers .i cant comment on the comfort of the item delivered because i cant get my feet into them.all this just because someone in the warehouse couldnt tell the difference between 10.5 and 12.so all in all i have not been too impressed with this firm :( and once my situation is resolved i doubt i will order from them again very unprofessional

Text: There was nothing wrong with these earrings in general but I had to return mine as they were much larger than I was expecting. That said comunication and delivery from Zalando was excellent and it was a very simple returns process. I re measured my feet and decided the smaller pair would be too small.  I have walked in them abit and they feel strange because of the thin sole, but very comfortable.  And I like the style was a piece to go with my jeans/leggings for when I have to walk places ( other shoes are not made for walking distances). I couldn't wear with jeans tucked in as the boots fitted my ankle and calf. Perfect to wear with a skirt but spoiled by gaping at the top. Text: These are gorgeous and has turned many heads from just one wear. They are ever so slightly small but they are relatively comfortable. These might have to be taxi to table sloooow-paced strolling boots, but they are so worth it!!

Text: This bag is of a lovely quality, soft leather. It has two main inner compartments separated by a third zipped compartment. Due to the softness of the leather, it doesn't really keep it's form when empty so if you're after a sturdy shaped bag, this isn't the one for you. It does have an optional long strap but because of the location of the strap rings, this makes the bag lop-sided so I'm going to remove it. Because of this, the smaller handles could do with being a little longer to accommodate for always using the bag over the shoulder. It does have some lovely details (leather labels, outer zip for keys, 2x inner compartments for phone/lipstick etc.) but I'm not quite sure about the 'rope' type addition along the bottom of the bag but it's easily removed. This bag is just the size I was looking for and I'm very happy with the purchase.

Text: I am so disappointed in these.  I have two pairs of caprice boots which I love and have found them to be some of the most comfortable shoes/boots I have ever had, so was really looking forward to these.  They seemed ok when I tried them on, I wish I had tried them for longer before wearing them out.  The inside of the toe is lined with a rigid liner which just gets more uncomfortable the longer you wear the boots.  I have now worn them for one day and one morning a few days later and I'm not sure hat I will ever wear them again - not much wear for 100 pounds.....
Title: Bad buy

Text: The flexibility of removable sleeves makes this into twice as much jacket for the price - which is fortunate since it's a bit expensive!  The fabric is showerproof (though the zip areas aren't).  Sizing is important on this item as it's cut to fit snugly.  I'm usually a size 40, with a little bit of a large waist at the moment.  I bought a size 36 (Italian size 50) and it was too small for me.  So I tried this in the 40 (Italian size 54) and it's too big.  UK size 38 of this jacket (Italian size 52) is just right... what a shame I can't get one in the dark blue or dark green any more.
Title: Really nice jacket

Text:
I absolutely loved it. The jacket looks a little bit like a biker jacket, very sexy! It's really well made and fits amazingly. Nice cut, good quality, perfect if you're going for the cool smart look.
I'm tall and rather slim (but not model-thin!) and there is usually something wrong with jackets for me - either sleeves are too short or it's too wide around the waist and too small around the shoulders; but this one fits just perfectly. That said, I didn't keep it because I knew I would be too conscious of its whiteness. Even though I had ordered it because I really didn't want another black jacket, I decided to go for the black one instead anyway; I just like it too much. I wish they had more colours!
Title: A perfect jacket

Text:
I really looked forward to receiving this and now I have my mitts on it there are a lot more positives than negatives. I went for the dusty olive and it's a bit darker than pictured but actually looks better for it, the sizing is spot on compared to the model shown, I'm 6'1", 38-39" chest and a medium was perfect. Zips and poppers are really great quality. Some nice touches not mentioned in the description are that the waist has a drawstring and the toggles are nicely hidden on the back of the hem, also the cuffs have poppers to close them up tight.

A couple of downsides to note are the inside pocket is pretty useless, it's a small horizontal pocket with one popper to close it, and the overall finish on mine was a bit messy - I must have easily had to trim over 20 long stray threads and still finding some.

That still doesn't take away from the fact this a great looking jacket and very nice to wear. If you can grab this at a sale price as I did I'm sure you won't regret it. I would rate it 4.5 stars if I could, but as I can't it's worth rounding up rather than down. Sorry for the long review, I hope it helps anyway.
Title: Great jacket! 4.5/5

Text:
Highly recommended!
This jacket is lovely! It's nice and lightweight, yet feature packed. It blocks out wind, rain, and snow! While keeping you dry (and a little warm). It's not padded or anything, but it's ideal as a throw over if going out to say the club, or driving to work.
The neck is nice and high, and zipped up fits well around the face. 
The smooth interior is great on the skin, as it doesn't feel rough like on other jackets.
It's also got a headphone connector. And two big internal pockets for storing valuables.
Lads - go get this jacket - it's good!

Highly recommend! Great product!

Text: Love these trainers!! I have been searching for a trainer with a gum sole, round toe and basketball style for ages and finally this has made my dreams come true. They are leather which is amazing, they fit so comfy for my wide feet and they are true to size. I am between a 3 and 4 so chose 3.5 which is perfect (I'm a 3 in Puma Classic Suede). They look awesome with all my jeans and I love the 90s feel. I really don't like the current pointy-trainers that are on the market so it took me forever to find something different to AirMax!! Definitely recommend. Ace quality, I know these will last me a while. Slightly disappointed the inside heel is polyester and not leather so it will wear away leaving a hole quite soon but I kinda don't mind too much.

Text: I think this is a very nice jacket. It fits quite tightly, which I like. It also quite short, but again I like this as it looks very good on me. I wear it to school but obviously with its short length and tight fit, I do not wear my school blazer under it. However, this is ok because I have my shirt and jumper on and have my blazer in my bag. I don't really wear my blazer anyway as it's uncool here. I recommend it as a school jacket for young teen boys as it is very sexy and cool. Just make sure you stuff your blazer in your bag or leave it at home if you can. You will probably have a jumper on anyway. It's not the warmest jacket out there but it's fashionable and comfy and I love it.

Text:
The shoes are a great style, just what I was looking for. The shape of the shoe is quite unique which is the reason I purchased.

At first I was very pleased with the shoes; they looked just as in the pictures and fit well.
Unfortunately after wearing them only 3 times, they started to fall apart quite obviously.
The frayed-look stitching started to come completely undone and I had to cut back the loose threads as they were constantly pulling out of the shoes.
The laces are so weak they snapped on both shoes whilst tying them.
The canvas body started to come away from the sole after about 7 days of wear, and the heel started to come away form the sole after a few weeks.

I have now owned the shoes for half a year, however after only wearing them around 10 times they joined the old and tatty selection!

All in all seems like a product made cheaply with an unjustifiable price tag, which is a real shame considering they look so nice.
Title: Poor Quality

Text:
These are the best tennis shoes I have ever had.

I play tennis regularly and this retro design is light on the feet but has the best grip. They also have some unique insoles with 'bubbles' on them which when you first wear them feel like you are walking on something but you get used to this and they actually make your feet more responsive. Modern tennis shoes are too clunky.

I first bought them in GREEN in London from a shoe shop on Portobello Road in 2015 and played with them for about a year until my toes almost came out on my right shoe in the last month.

I finally found them online after searching for ages and Zalondo has them for a great price in GREEN/BLUE/WHITE.
Title: Nike Meadows - Best Tennis Shoes Ever

Text:
I've been looking for a high-waisted pair of skinny jeans for a while and never come across a pair that both looked good on and didn't wreck my budget (especially as I bought them on sale). Normally I wouldn't dare to buy online but with free returns I figured why not and I am totally love with these. 

Note: I also ordered them in 'earl grey' at the same time. The first pair were ridiculously tight around the waist with 2-3cm difference between the 'kelly blue'. So I ordered a second pair which seems to be more the right size (although the 'earl grey' seem to be a little tighter overall).
Title: New favourites

Text:
My purchase was a disaster and a disappointment. 
The shoes were beautiful, just like I imagined them. Unfortunately they were not the same size. Both size 38  as indicated on the box and the soles, but definitely not the same size. I struggled to put the left one on, but it was okay, then I was surprised with the right one, it was like a very easy slip on shoe, it was too big. 
I sadly had to return them . 
Although I was upset not to be able to keep the shoes, I was satisfied with the service. I got my delivery in just few days, and also got my money back in my account just 3 days after I dropped my parcel at a Hermes Shop.
Title: Happy with Zalando, not happy with the Shoe manufacturer

Text: I have been a great fan of the older gel-blade 3 model – the 5 is as good, if not a tad better, love those . Excellent grip on court, great fit, snug in right places without the bulk, comfortable toe box. As a guide, (my personal preference for squash shoes) I do usually buy 0.5 size bigger shoes to allow for a foot swelling, as natural as possible foot  and heel fit, (flat heel), roomy, wide toe box, well fitted and snug heel – to avoid the dreaded up and down movement (and blisters!) in over stuffed padded shoes. I play squash play nearly every day. Incidentally, found the blade 4 model,  far too soft and baggy.
Title: Excellent grip on court, great fit, snug in right places without the bulk.

My Stats - Size 12, Height 5'6", Bust 36DD

Text:
Unfortunately I find these shoes uncomfortable. You can’t roll your feet properly and the solid sole bangs against your heel when you walk. 
The hole in the heel looks cool, and is something a bit different. Even my husband noticed it. I ordered the shoes in my usual size and I find them a little bit long at the back.
Unfortunately the colours look a bit different to the original, and the left and right foot don’t completely match each other. On the left shoe there was only a little bit of pink just on the inside, on the right the whole bit across the buckle was pink. Strange combination. They should look out for that when they are packing the shoes.
Title: funky shoes but uncomfy

Text: A great pair of shoes for the summer. Because of the plastic soles they are really light and comfortable to wear, but it looks like proper wood. The bright colours are also great for the warm weather, they will definitely liven up every outfit. The soft strap means the shoe fits well around the foot, but isn’t too tight. With the knobbled plastic sole you can wear them in a light shower and walk on damp streets. All in all, very nice, and at that price you could buy several pairs.
Title: great summer shoes

Text:
I got these for Christmas and am very very pleased. 
Buttery soft leather, lovely soft suede inner and a nice little leather pad under the heel. 
The soles are leather but with rubber inserts for durability and grip (as leather can be quite slippery by itself) they seem nice and grippy to me which is a bonus. they also seem like they would be fairly easy to re-sole.

they have a workable (not just decorative) drawstring which allows you to adjust the fit somewhat if you find them a little loose around your foot even though the length is fine. 

I have particularly narrow and shallow feet and usually take a size 5/5.5/6 .. i got a 5.5 in these and they fit perfectly though i would advise that those with average/wide feet may wish to order a larger size (some reviews i've seen say a whole size up) .. with zalando's free postage you'll be able to try until you find the perfect size for you.

Text:
This jacket has a more practical than fashionable look but is well made and well-designed, especially for the very reasonable price.  I have not worn it properly yet so cannot comment on factors like durability.  The size is generous but not overly so. Medium fits me well with some room for jumpers underneath, I am a slim 12.  It fits well, apart from the hood maybe.  Its 'end flaps' lie on your shoulder looking like epaulettes from the front (as seen on pics with model wearing it).  If you don't like that look, you can tuck the end flaps into little 'pockets' in the collar, and fastened them there with one press stud one each side designed for that purpose.  This is an ingenious design to hide the flaps, but it constricts the hood somewhat so it doesn't fall nicely at the back, and is harder to pull over your head.  I prefer the jacket with the hood off, and would wear a hat instead, although the hood is nice and warm as filled with down too.

I like the many different pockets, although most of them are a little smaller than I expected, but this is not a serious issue as there are many of them.  The inside pocket is designed for an mp3 player, with an extra hole for the headphones cable. FGreat attention to detail.  Also nice shade of dark brown and matt finish. Slightly rough feel to outer fabric, water pearls off well.

I would have liked some horizontal quilting which may have made the jacket look more stylish, and would ensure even distributed throughout the jacket.  However, so far this doesn't seem a problem as the filling appears to be well distributed.
Title: Well-made, practical jacket

Text:
I've been looking for a kind of 'April coat, when the skies hang grey and sunless and the
wind isn't strong, for when I go walking the dog.  The Even&Odd Parka, with its mid-length polyester lined cotton composition, with one big solid zip, which can be thrown in the washing machine if it gets muddy, works supremely well for me here in England, where
the weather requires such a covering.  My family say the coat has a green military kind
of look, but smart, and a lot more expensive looking than a usual coat of this price.
Altogether I am wholly delighted with my purchase.  Postage and packing excellent,
and it arrived well within the stated date.  Many thanks for this.
Title: Walking the dog

Text: This parka is great. Really good quality and more than I would have expected considering the price. Love the style - casual yet smart, really nice colour and fabric, true to size. It's exactly what I've been looking for. The delivery was nice and quick - received it on the fourth day after placing the order. Great service. Really pleased!
Title: Great coat and great service!

Text: excellent service,start to finish.I like the free delivery and return policy,also excellently packed.

Text: Good solid boots. Very plain styling which I was after (hate bright coloured boots!). Feel fantastic on, really supports the foot well and the leather is really soft and supple. Soles give excellent traction on hard indoor floors. Good quality, very happy. Go a half size up though as they run a little small.
Title: Best indoor boots.

Text: I really love Fly Boots and have been searching and searching for Fly Mol in Dark Brown but they're sold out everywhere!  I managed to find them with Zalando at a great price. £90 when they're at least £135 in the shops! Quick delivery, no problems at all.

Text: These boots are significantly smaller than usual sizes. I ordered them in two sizes, because I'm usually in between sizes and even the bigger ones were tight. I'd recommend going at least one size up particularly if you need to put an insole in. The boots themselves are really lovely and comfortable too. Perfect to wear with jeans or skirts.
Title: nice boots

Text:
I have size 7 feet and quite skinny calves.  These boots are perfect - so many other boots are like wellies on me!  They have a snug fit, great shape, good quality leather etc.  I wear them under jeans (although they'd be fab with skinny jeans too) and mostly with black tights and skirts - perfect for winter weather.

I've actually bought a pair every year for the last few years!  Testament to how much I love this Fly London boot.  I wear them nearly every day except in the summer so they get a lot of wear.  This new pair felt a little stiff but I think they just need breaking in now.

Very happy with my purchase.
Title: Lovely boots - perfect for skinny calves

Text: Lovely boots. I'd recommend buying a size larger if you want to put an insole in. I like them a lot.

Text: Got up this morning and found an email from Zalando asking me what I thought of my new boots ....... only I cant actually tell you on account Zalando use Yodel for delivery so I'm still waiting. Yodel, via tracking, said that they would be delivered yesterday, so I stayed in ALL day, when I checked again at 7.50pm the parcel had been returned to the depot with a 'consignee not reachable' comment. I called Yodel, and wonders will never cease, they actually answered the phone this time (yes this is the 3rd delivery from Yodel and the 3rd time I have had major hassles with them!!!!!!!). I asked why when I was in, I also asked why no delivery card ... well asked is not quite the truth, demanded, shouted and fumed is perhaps nearer the truth! The upshot, the driver apparently just pressed any button (the comment about the consignee is not reachable ... the machine is very small, they cant always read it!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!) and in actual fact they did not attempt a delivery at all. I asked for delivery tomorrow, they said this is impossible (their words) as I did not pay for Saturday deliver on order!!!!! despite more shouting, ranting and raving that I had fulfilled my part by staying in when required to so this was not my fault, no they were in no way delivering to me on a Saturday .. so I have to wait till Monday when I will have to be out, or Tuesday.  THIS SERVICE IS ABSOLUTELY SHOCKING AND I FOR ONE WILL NOT BE USING ANY COMPANY THAT INSISTS ON USING YODEL FOR DELIVERY. As for the boots, well this is my 2nd pair, bought the tan ones locally in store (they don't do black) and I love them to bits.
Title: They Asked what I thought!

Text: A truly wonderful coat!  Beautiful, thoughtfuldesign and quality fabric. I have been looking for a coat like this for ages and am so thrilled with this Jack Wolfskin product that I am a complete convert to this brand.  My first purchase from Zalando and I was extremely impressed with the high standard of customer service.  Thank you!

Text: This is my third pair of ankle boots from Zign and Zalando.  In fact, my fourth, as I've doubled up on one of my pairs.  These are another wonderful pair of boots.  I'm larger than a size 4 and smaller than a size 5 and all of the Zign boots I've bought in size 5 are the closest I've found to a good fit. They are lovely items, especially at current sale prices.  They are great for between seasons or a cooler summer day, the yellow is subtle and the heel is a good height but easy to wear with the wider stacked heel style.  Excellent boots at an excellent price.

Text: These are my third pair of Ayami running capri's from ASICS and I must say I love them. Firstly, they stand out from the crowd - there's nothing else like them on the market in the UK - everyone can see you coming in these. The wild patterns are actually very flattering as they hide any lumps or bumps which one colour lycra can sometimes high-light. There's a flat pocket along the back for mobile, tissues or an energy gel and a small front internal product for keys. The waitsband is one that will stay up throughout a long run. I wore some Ayami's for the Great South run - 10 miles and they were very comfortable all the way round. I'd recommend them to anyone and am so glad I don't have to trek to the London Asics shop now that Zalando stock this range. Very quick posting and good quality packing as well. Nice one.
Title: Stand out from the crowd running gear

Text: I ordered a size up because I have bought clothes from Sisley in the past and they were always too small.  Same with this coat. Although it is a perfectly nice coat, the shape was nice, it was not too "puffy", it had a hood which was my main reason for buying it and it was warm,  unfortunately a size 14 was just too tight across the chest and hips and I am a size 12.  I would have needed the size 16.  Another coat caught my eye in the end but one thing I was really impressed with was Zalando delivered the coat in lightening fast time, I received delivery details telling me my parcel would be delivered between 10am-11am on the day which was really helpful, I returned my parcel with no  problems and received a refund straightaway, so for service I would give 5 stars.

Text: Zalando is an excellent service: informative on purchase and speedy delivery.  However, I ordered a thin summer scarf (very nice, thank you) and it came in a shoe-box sized cardboard box filled with those inflatable polythene pillows, just in case the scarf got smashed en route.  This is a bit of overkill and a bit of a big flat carbon footprint. . Packaging should be minimal wherever possible, guys!

Text: After much searching I have finally found the perfect gym bag! Since the demise of my old, much loved, gym bag I have been looking for a new one. This is the fourth one I have bought and it's a keeper. The first bag I bought was so organised and had so many pockets there wasn't enough space in the main compartment for my kit and towel. The second bag looked lovely but had two useless pockets (only fastening with a small piece of velcro and therefore not secure) and one large main compartment. The third bag was much too big and looked like I was going on holiday for a fortnight! The fourth bag (this one) is just right. It is big enough to take all my kit, whether it's a session at the gym or at the pool. It has two good size end pockets which fit it all my toiletries (inc. full sized bottles) and drinks bottle etc. It has a roomy front pocket which is large enough to take an A5 diary , hairbrush, phone , purse and keys. Inside there is a further zipped pocket (which fits my make up bag in it) and two mesh pockets which are very useful for bits and bobs. The main compartment is roomy and fits my trainers, kit, bath sheet size towel and bikini. The bag is well made , the fabric is robust and everything about it says quality. The padded shoulder strap makes it really comfortable to carry. It is neither too big nor too small. I would highly recommend this bag. The service from Zalando was great too, the bag was well packaged and arrived quickly. All round a great buy!
Title: Excellent Sports bag

Text:
I came new to running, at 65 yrs old, about a year and a half ago. My wife treated me to my first pair of Hattori which were fastened with velcro tabs and which I have now replaced with Hattori LC. I think I probably ran about 1500 miles in the old pair, mostly over forest trails and footpaths and also through mud and snow, and I am now about four stone lighter. I have learned to trust these apparently flimsy shoes in all sorts of conditions and now look forward to some races in my new pair.
I think their lightness and 'zero drop' wern't a problem for me because I had never done any running before; running in them on stony and mixed ground at sixteen stone certainly trained me not to land heavy and I have so far been lucky enough to avoid injury. I also wear them for weight training and yoga and they give a good solid grounding; I now feel other gym shoes I wore in the past were too squishy to do this.
To sum up, I love these because they are light, tough, and have taught me to run with strong feet and good balance.
Title: Saucony Hattori LC

Title: The worst service i have recieved from any supplier

Text: More Chelsea tractor than serious offroader!.
Title: Dissapointing

Text:
First impression of the boot's is that they are really more of a dark blue colour than black, the pull tab on the heel is not substantial and the 'laces' are purely decorative.

Walked eight mile's in them, a combination of road, track, fell, bog, up and down hill's, - I should add this is a regular walk and I have no problems walking it wearing my regular walking boot's

I found the Viking boot's to be quite a snug fit on the foot to start with but the insole flattened and my feet moved around quite a lot resulting in my little toes rubbing against the side of the boot's, there is no way to tighten the boot's so thicker sock's will need to be worn in future.
The sole is not as supportive as I would have hoped and my heel's were hurting after about six miles and it was a relief to arrive home and take the boot's off, although they did keep my feet warm and dry this is poor consolation as an hour later my feet still hurt, I will have to buy some insoles to make them more comfortable. 

If like me you do a lot of walking/hiking  these are not ideal I had hoped for a Walking boot x Wellington that would be suitable for walking in all day -  Urban Outdoor is all they are suitable for, overall I would say I am disappointed that these boot's are not as good as I hoped and will only be wearing them on shorter walks and in the snow.
I now need to buy another pair of walking boot's!! - anyone recommend?
Title: Urban Outdoor use only - don't like me hike eight miles in them!.

Text:
More Chelsea tractor than serious offroader.

Firstly I ordered them in black and have to say the colour is more dark blue than black but I wasn't really bothered by that as I wanted the boot's, the  laces are decorative only and pull tab is flimsy.
Wanted something that was a cross between a wellington and a walking boot that would be comfortable to wear all day - these are not, although they kept my feet warm and dry they are not for hiking in, walked a regular route of eight miles on combination of road, track, fell's and bog, up and down hill's and these are my findings:-
Snug fit when first put on but the insole flattened and my feet moved around and little toes rubbed on the insides of the boots, at six mile point my heels were hurting and it was a relief to arrive home after eight miles and take the boot's off, I will have to put some thicker insoles in them before I wear them again as an hour later my feet still hurt, in fact I am still in pain this morning and not very happy at all.

These boot's are not for serious walkers, Urban Outdoor only.

I researched, read reviews for the Viking KAISA HI GTX  boot's prior to my purchase and thought they would suit me and be fit for purpose- it say's walking / hiking boot's and that was what I expected - yes you can walk in these boot's but they are not from my experience 'Hiking' boots, although I am not an expert I would say the problem lies in the construction of the 'foot bed' and sole.
I have an Irish Setter (my second dog)  - I walk an average of eight miles every day, I have more miles on me than a second hand car, I need a pair of boot's that is able to stand up to all terrains as I walk/ hike over hill's and fell's, is comfortable to wear for hours
 
To quote Viking's own description of the boot:- 

''The last is especially designed using Viking's experience of "Nordic" women's needs in the winter. Where women are active outdoors even in the depths of freezing winters, good fitting lasts are vital. The heel cup is slimmer than the men's, giving excellent heel grip with no slipping up and down inside the shoes. The instep holds the foot and stops it sliding forwards, while the toe box is roomy enough so that toes don't get cramped together and freeze''.

I'm not sure that a  ''Nordic'' women's needs are any more important than my own or how 'active she is outdoors' but the boot's can't 'walk the walk!'. 

Having now worn my new ''Hiking'' boots I have to say I am very disappointed and will be contacting Viking directly over their product that for me is a very costly and ill afforded mistake.
Title: Disappointing

Text:
I was looking for a new pair of boot's for winter and wanted something that was a cross between a walking boot and wellington that would be comfortable to wear all day, I researched, read reviews and saw the Viking KAISA boot's and purchased a pair.
 Firstly colour is more dark blue than black but I wasn't really bothered by that as I wanted the boot's, the laces are decorative only and pull tab is flimsy.
 
As I said I wanted something that would be comfortable to wear all day - these are not, although they kept my feet warm and dry they are not for hiking in, walked a regular route of eight miles on combination of road, track, fell's and bog, up and down hill's and these are my findings.
 
Snug fit when first put on but the insole flattened and my feet moved around and little toes rubbed on the insides of the boots, at six mile point my heels were hurting and it was a relief to arrive home after eight miles and take the boot's off, I will have to put some thicker insoles in them before I wear them again as an hour later my feet still hurt, to say I am not very happy is an understatement.

These boot's are not for serious walkers, Urban Outdoor only and then not very far, have tried them on the flat on grass and pavement but can honestly say they are the most uncomfortable pair of boots I have ever worn - I'm 59 years old and walk between eight and twelve miles a day so I know what I am talking about.
 
Having worn my new boots I am very disappointed in the product that for me is a very costly and ill affordable mistake.

Very comfortable to wear and it keeps out wind and water and so far it's the best jacket I have owned ever.

Text: On my screen, these shoes appear to be a muted burgundy/maroon colour although they are described as 'red'. I asked the customer support about this and they replied: "For future reference, what you will receive is the color that was displayed in the photos.  'Red' in this instance is simply an identifier provided to us from the manufacturer to describe the product." In fact the shoes are a bright red, not burgundy. They are comfortable, but too early to say how durable they are.

Text: Well made sandals with a classic look and proper old-fashioned leather that would doubtless wear well and give long-term comfort. However, I have taken a size 10.5 for most of my adult life and these sandals flapped around on my feet. I would estimate they were at least 1 size too large, with insufficient adjustment points. A shame, as there were no size 10 or 9.5 available to try, so I had to return them.

Text:
In addition to my other review, I just wanted to add that the sizing is small.

I am normally an 8 but when I bought these in 8 I can only wear these shoes with very thin socks, rather than chunkier woolly/sports socks.

Text:
I bought these as normal walking around town shoes, and chose black in order to be discreet. The fabric looks slightly more purple than I thought it would, but oh well.

I've not run in these, but walking around is extremely comfortable. These are much more waterproof than other trainers I've worn in the past so I would highly recommend them for walking around, even in fairly terrible weather. I personally wouldn't run in these as I get hot feet, and the ventilation isn't as good as in most running Asics (I have other Asics that are lighter and have more ventilation than these). These would feel too chunky for running in I think.
Title: Really nice waterproof shoes - for walking

Text: lovely vibrant colours, excellent quality and detailing, keeps my little man from the wind and rain. I was initially disappointed at the fleece inner being quite thin, but it seems warm enough for normal winter use, best suited for active use though. Sizing seems in line with other clothing for 6 year olds although this is what I have to buy for a 3&3/4 year old. Fleece inner jacket is a bright blue, lighter and more vivid than the outer shell and has lime green trimming. Reflective strips very effective.

The colours, long sleeves and it's listing in 'Jersey Dresses' led me to believe that this is an Autumnal item of clothing, so it's just slightly disappointing that although very pretty, it's very thin - basically 100% cotton like a T-shirt. 
It is actually listed as such in the product detail, I see now, but at the time was misled by the word 'jersey' and the thickness of material that brings to mind. 
So, very nice but will be covered with a cardigan, which is a bit of a shame.
Title: Nice design, but...

Text: I ordered these boots and after a few days received an email stating their dispatch, used tracking but the boots never moved anywhere. When I had finally waited far more than long enough as it was December delivery's I rang Zalando, I was informed that it looked like the boots had gone through dispatch but had never got to yodel for actual delivery. I took the option to wait another week to see if they could find them......but to no avail. I asked could they dispatch another pair but they stated I would have to re-order. This was so unfair as the boots had been on offer plus I had a code for 15% off for one day only. The boots are now back up to full price and I have lost my money off code. I am so so cross at what had happened, and I wont re-order and pay £140 when my original order came to £106.

Text:
They look pretty stylish and the material is quite comfortable, HOWEVER....the labels are so uncomfortable that I had to rip them out while I was still wearing the shorts. It felt like I had 3 seconds to remove them or I would have stared crying. It reminded me of some value underwear my Mum bought me when I was in infant school. Back then, I didn't realise there was a solution so I wore them all day and burst into tears on my return home. So when I put these on some 25 years later and experienced those similar sensations of pain, discomfort and rage that I was transported back mentally to a very unhappy place. If I was in America, I would probably try and sue Bjorn for $8million for the mental anguish. But we're not in America, so I'll just do the British thing and not buy any more. Quite a similar sentiment though. 

Also, on the theme of ridiculously poor quality control - there is a seam that runs doen the front of the pants. You know...where the penis normally rests. Yep, a seam that runs down where you would want a nice smooth surface. It may be a luxury flatlocked seam but its still a source of irritation of you were going to wear these for a long day/night. 

So that's a double fault as far as I'm concerned Bjorn. A very disappointing double fault to lose the match.
Title: Only Bjorn Borg could wear these without getting annoyed

Text: The boots were too large so I followed the instructions to the nearest drop and collect service.  They would not take the package (although it was exactly as sent by you) saying it was too large and they would get in to trouble.  I had to find another drop and collect point.  Luckily I have a car.  What do people do if they don't have a car?  It took me into a large housing estate.  It was a Londis store with 6 teens drinking beer wearing hoodies outside standing over someone lying on the ground unconscious.  As I was parking an ambulance pulled up and blocked me in so I had no choice but to watch them try and resuscitate him.  This was a frightening experience for a lone woman.  I think you should select your drop and collect points in key traffic, well lit areas.  At least they took the boots.
Title: Disappointed in customer service

Text: The boots were excellent but just didn't fit me correctly.  Trying to return them was fraught with problems.  The Customer Services team are helpful if not always accurate.  The problem is that there are no Hermes return shops near where I live and when the boots are collected from my home there is no indication of time so I could possibly be waiting in all day just to return something.  The boots weren't collected on the day that we arranged and when I rang up a date could not be scheduled till the following week.  The next day however Hermes arrived to collect them.  The left doesn't seem to know what the right is doing.  Why can't you operate CollectPlus which is far more efficient with far more dropping off locations.  At the very least you could offer people Royal Mail.  I'm not prepared to drive 40 minutes to return a parcel to a Hermes depot and neither am I prepared to wait in ALL day for Hermes to collect from me.  Until you make returns easier I will not be ordering from you again.
Title: Poor Returns Policy

Text:
I purchased a pair of Oliver Sweeney shoes from Zalando. The product itself was great....the delivery and service were the worst I have ever experienced. I was informed that the order had been placed and was being delivered to my home address. I specifically entered my work address as the delivery address as I am not home to receive packages during the day. I emailed them to notify them it was incorrect and they admitted to there being a system error. I was informed my delivery address had been changed. Low and behold there was an attempt to deliver at my home address. I emailed Zalando who said that it can take two to three days to change address with the courier company (Hermes). After many many emails back and forth with Zalando over a two week period regarding changing my delivery address, a note landed on my door mat from Hermes with a phone number to contact them directly regarding yet another failed delivery. When I did, they said that Zalando had never requested that my address be changed. 

Zalando on each occasion offered no solution and even tried to fob me off with a measly £5 voucher for my next order when I said how unhappy I was with their service. Needless to say I will not be using them again! After 10 failed delivery attempts I eventually got my shoes which were...well....Oliver Sweeney shoes. You cannot go wrong, amazing quality and build and super cool looks. 

I would avoid using this company.
Title: Zzzzzzzalando. Do not buy from this company!!!

Text:
The boots were recommended to me by my sister who lives in cold Sweden while I'm in London where the weather seems to change quite a lot. She was saying that they may be too warm for British weather but I can confirm they are just perfect! I love the boots. I'm usually size 41/42 (UK size 8/9). For boots I always go for size 9 to fit a warmer sock. They fit well, very comfy, easy to walk long distances. I broke my ankle a couple of years back so stability and comfort were the key points when I was looking for boots. These match perfectly. I love Tamaris! I've got another pair of Tamaris high heels I bought ages ago.. they look great! Haven't had to change anything, the sole is still in great condition and I have walked with them a lot!

Great purchase and would definitely buy Tamaris shoes again. Fast delivery by Zalando as well. Thank you!

Text:
Really well made good quality jacket for the money. Have had Icepeak stuff before and it is always good quality with great functionality, unfortunately the brand is not that easy to get in the UK.

The jacket has lots of pockets including, two external hand warmer pockets, external Napoleon pocket, a ski pass pocket on the sleeve, an internal MP3 pocket, a mobile phone pocket and a mesh goggles pocket with a goggle wipe attached. It is also lightly padded for warmth, with a fleece lining on the upper back/shoulders. The snow skirt is detachable and the hood will fit over a ski helmet. The pit zips are mesh lined and are quite small, they sit on the body part of the pit and not the sleeve. This means there are no zips restricting your arm movement, but ventilation may not be quite as good as some other jackets.

Size wise, I am a 40" chest and 34" waist and the medium (50 European size) is a good fit with room for layers underneath.

The only thing stopping it get a 5 at the moment is it hasn't been tested on the slopes yet!

Text: I'm a Postman so these are taking a beating each week. I've done about a hundred miles over the past couple of weeks and they're fantastic. No blisters, no hot spots and plenty of toe wiggle room whilst nicely holding your foot around the instep and heel. For any minimalist runners out there, these are a bit more beefed up than I would normally go for; more stack height and more cushioning in the heel than the New Balance Mt 10 for example but carrying weight over a variety of terrains and switching between walking and trotting they're perfect. Great grippy sole even in the wet on concrete and pavement. Definitely recommend!

Text:
My fiancé ordered these shoes for our wedding day. What a handsome pair of shoes indeed! As a UK size 13 he often struggles finding shoes that fit, but Zalando and Melvin & Hamilton have a great range of shoes in his size.

I don't have any criticisms and they arrived promptly, but just a word of warning to others ordering from this designer: make sure you follow the manufacturers' size guide rather than the UK size guide because they are labelled differently, and whereas my partner usually wears a UK size 13 (euro 47), the size 13 for this shoe was a euro 48 — which was way too big!

Zalando were great and refunded us for the wrong pair and I ordered the correct size when it came in stock. We're both very happy. A quality shoe and service indeed!
Title: Now that's what I call a shoe!

Still might cut lining shorts out.. not sure yet.

Over all a lovely pair of shorts, nice colour, nice fit, nice material.

Text:
They're lovely. They look so different to normal heels that I get about 3 people commenting on them a day.
- “Where did you get those??”
- “Zalando”
-“Z-what-O?”
Then you have to explain what the internet is… haha
They rub a little bit – as all new shoes do. But it wasn’t anything a plaster couldn’t fix, and i’m happily wearing them all day. 
The elastic doesn’t rub at all (I thought it might) obviously they stay on brilliantly – so none of that ‘opps I nearly broke my ankle falling’ when your heel slips off.  The heel is the perfect height for work, (office) but looks good with jeans too. Glad I bought them. I’m always pleased with Anna Field shoes.

Text:
These shoes are unbelievably soft and comfortable. I have a bunion on one foot and neuromas on both feet so it is very difficult to find pretty shoes that are comfortable.

My bunion foot is two width sizes larger than the other but these shoes fit both feet very comfortably. The insole is leather with memory foam beneath which adds to the comfort. Text:

As it's a thin jacket, there are only two pockets: waist height on the exterior.

Text:
The positive

The quality is great. Handles my 17 inch laptop, a notebook and some bits and bobs without straining, and the padding on the strap is very comfortable and cushioning. No shoulder marks to date! 

The negative

The strap is really long, and although it can be shortened with a clip on one side, the clip is not as strong as it looks, so the strap gradually creeps through, forcing you to stop and readjust the strap length about three times a day. 

When the strap is set to a shorter length there's nowhere for the strap to go so you end up with a loop of spare strap flapping loose.
Title: Mixed feelings

Text: The jeans came when promised and were a lovely fit and I was very happy.  Less then 4 months later they have developed numerous holes; around the pockets and each belt hoop (theses jeans are loose on me not tight).   I have never had this problem with any other Pepe jeans.  Zalando refused to help me as I had the first hole repaired they deemed the warranty to have expired despite the fact I could not have possibly known they were going to literally fall to pieces afterwards and it was quite obviously a faulty pair of jeans.  What a waste of money!  Will never shop with Zalando again and I am not sure I would trust Pepe jeans again - I might try going direct instead of being at the mercy of a reseller.
Title: Nice jeans except they fell to pieces.

Text: I'm very pleased with these boots. They are very comfy and good at repelling water (I walked across boggy ground in the Lake District and my feet stayed dry). Easy to put on and off and they fit well over trousers. The colour is a lovely warm grey, almost olive green. The very small heel gives a bit of a lift but they are very easy to walk in. Good room for toes. I also like the lovely inner lining and the fact that they stand up by themselves i.e. no flopping over. I would have preferred them slightly more fitted around the ankle but all in all I'm glad I've finally found the boots i wanted.

    5 Can you make a pet of him like a bird or put him on a leash for your girls?
    6 Will traders barter for him? Will they divide him up among the merchants?
    7 Can you fill his hide with harpoons or his head with fishing spears?
    8 If you lay a hand on him, you will remember the struggle and never do it again!
    9 Any hope of subduing him is false; the mere sight of him is overpowering.
    10 No-one is fierce enough to rouse him. Who then is able to stand against me?
    11 Who has a claim against me that I must pay? Everything under heaven belongs to me.
    12 I will not fail to speak of his limbs, his strength and his graceful form.
    13 Who can strip off his outer coat? Who would approach him with a bridle?
    14 Who dares open the doors of his mouth, ringed about with his fearsome teeth?

Text: I bought this to wear it under my waterproof regatta trisha jacket. This Twintip Fleece is very well made, very warm, true to size and very flattering as it follows the body's curves. Note that it is long enough to cover your buttocks, so it's good for sitting on cold benches. Text: First of all, Zalando get top marks for their customer service.  I have mixed feelings about my Ferrox GTX LO shoes, though.  I am a great Lowa fan and have all kinds of Lowa shoes, trekking and mountain climbing boots.  I was disappointed to find that for the Ferrox shoes, Lowa have chosen to do only whole sizes, with half sizes being created by sticking a thicker insole into a larger size.  For example, my Ferrox shoes are UK size 5.5; size 5 was too small and size 6 too large.  However, in reality my UK size 5.5 are simply size 6, with Lowa having inserted a marginally thicker sole to take up the inner volume.  This means that my shoes will always be longer than I would like, with the upper part constantly folding in uncomfortably over my toes.  Also, the tread/sole of the Ferrox shoes does not have a good grip on wet, smooth surfaces, so there is a tendency to slip and lose one’s footing unless you are very careful.  To finish off on a positive note, my Ferrox shoes are stylish, comfortable (apart from over my toes where the fabric buckles inwards), and they are definitely much better made than other brands in the same price range (e.g. Meindl, Salomon, and Merrell).
Title: Ferrox shoes - good and bad points

Text:
Love at first sight with these boots! Lovely dark green textured leather shaft  Foot is polished leather with a  slightly metallic heel and the strap over the instep is made of strands of the different boot leathers with one made of tiny metal squares. Really unusual boots to suit an average foot width of C-D, and calf that come up to 1.5 inches below my knee ( 5' 6" height) I can wear these with a thin jean- they zip up fine. I am confident that they will give slightly as I have a high instep and that is a bit tight currently and makes removing them slightly difficult requiring a good pull. They are a beautiful boot and the shaft is also slightly ruched which is very flattering to the leg and a contrasting unpolished leather to the foot. Very designer looking in appearance and just elegant on- the cowboy influence is just a slightly almond, raised  toe  and curved heel- the only Biker influence is the stranded strap across the instep. Beautiful quality and the 2 inch heel is not noticeable as it is across the entire width of the heel area making them as comfy to walk in as a flat boot for everyday wear, which I am loath to do as they are really special and distinctive suitable for any length of skirt, dress or trouser. 
   Many Thanks Zalando for a fabulous, huge selection of gorgeous boots that I would never find or see in my locale and a hassle free returns system that allows me to find my perfect fitting boot at a reasonable price.
Title: These boots are made for gawping

Text:
I first saw this coat on the ONLY website and fell in love, but they wouldn't accept returns and I didn't know the fit so I decided to shop around. 
I then stumbled upon Zalando, but they only had M in stock, deciding to give it a whirl I ordered the coat (after signing up for the newsletter to get £10 off!). When it arrived I discovered it was too big (I'd say it'd fit a size 12 brilliantly) so I sent it back.
A couple of weeks later I was on here again and the coat was in stock in a smaller size (S & XS). I ordered the S because I like to wear jumpers under coats, but when I opened the box today I found that they had sent me an XS by mistake, I tried it on and the fit was brilliant so thank you Zalando for the mistake! I love the coat, it's fully lined in fake fur and incredibly warm...can't wait to show it off :)
Title: If you are reading this stop, add the coat to your basket and be done with it!

Text: Decided I really needed to replace my old, worn pair of Asics and came across these! I absolutely love the colours (they're the nicest looking running shoes I've ever had!). Obviously for £50  they're not the best Asics trainers you can get, but they do have rearfoot gel and are very lightweight and comfortable to run in (though I've only ever worn them indoors on equipment at a gym). I'm a size 6 but have quite wide feet and took a chance buying them in a 6, but they fit perfectly and I almost have a thumb worth of space between my big toe and the end of the shoe. Definitely recommend.
Title: Stylish, comfortable trainers for sports/gym.

Text: I was happy with the style of the product, the fit when I first tried it on, was good. Delivery was good quick, and well managed to my point of vue.  But then I wore it 3 times and, then something went wrong. the strap on the left sandal started to come off my feet when I walked. So then I end up walking on it and damaged the leather. This happened when I was on holiday, so it was rather annoying. Then I looked at the shoes more closely and release that the left strap was much longer than the right one. so even though I put it at the tightest hole it didn't work. So i had to do a hole myself in the straps, as I was on holiday I ddin't have much other shoes to wear. The sandals are too loose for me so I guess they won't last me more than one summer. So I'm rather disappointed, and obviously the left shoes is more damaged now due to the product fault. I don't know if anything can be done about it. Let me precise that I am a 38 but I have wide foot.

Text: I bought these shoes recently and found them to be very cheaply made.  The leather didn't cover the full length of the heel and there was a substantial amount of glue visible.  The sole of the heel wasn't straight and the plastic was poor and looked as though it would wear down very quickly.  Also, the elastic material connecting the ankle strap to the buckle was of very poor material and very flimsy.  These are inexcusable faults for a pair of shoes costing £65.00, so I returned them and received a full refund.  I would consider buying other items from Zalando but would be very vigilant where quality is concerned.
Title: Poor quality

Text: Excellent quality trainers at an incredible price. I had never heard of Zalando until I found these trainers at a fantastic price on a web search. I even found a voucher for an extra tenner off and got myself £100 worth of Nike Air for £60! I felt uneasy about the purchase until they arrived on time and in perfect condition. Will definitely return to Zalando in future.

Text:
I keep a very active lifestyle and need a wardrobe to match! Im starting to build up key pieces and this has proved to be a great buy! After wearing it a few times during gym workouts and my cycle commute i can happily state this t shirt is amazing for combating sweat and odour. It comes with a heavy price tag but you truly pay for what you get, you can feel the technical compression working in the key areas of your torso and regulates bodyheat perfectly. The quality of the material used is lovely and I really like the style and fit, not what you see your average gym-goer dressing in :)
The only downside to this top is that it does not have a silicone hem gripper seal to stop the top from riding up otherwise I would of happily awarded 5 stars. Will defo buy from this brand again
Title: Great quality compression top

Text: I am about 6ft and a 33 inch waste (sometimes 34) of medium build, about 40 inch chest. I bought this in large but could have got into a medium but I prefer a slightly looser fit for ease of slipping in and out of it. I like this as it is longer in the sleave and shorter in length than many other softshells. It is so comfortable and very stylish without being to much in your face. If your like me and like to put a heavy phone and wallet in your pocket then you may wish to get a medium size as it holds them tighter to your body when bouncing around but that said, I'm still happy with mine. As it is probably at least two thirds the price of others I may even buy a second one. I just love this jacket.

Text: I cannot comment on the product, since it is a present for a nephew.  However, these high tops look to be good quality, well made and are certainly good looking.  I can however comment on the order and delivery process - what a joy!  Easy website to use, swift checkout, and confirmation of order through to delivery absolutely excellent.  The parcel arrived within two days, almost before our very slow internet had made the order!  This has been the easiest and best service of this year's Christmas shopping experience - thank you the Zalando team, I can't praise you highly enough!
Title: Excellent!

Text:
First, let me say that the delivery of these shoes was spot on. I ordered on a Friday and had them early on Monday. So that was wonderful.
But the shoes themselves leave a bit to be desired. I've worn them twice. After the first half-hour of wear, the layer covering the shoe (the layer than makes them iridesce,) was peeling like skin off of a bad sunburn. The bits that have already flaked off (on my second wear) show that this layer is necessary for the look of the shoe; without it, no iridescence, no 'oil spill' look. Worse, when it does flake off, bits of the undercoating come off too, exposing the black rubber base of the shoe. It's a shame, because I was really excited about these shoes, have missed the black patent oil spill look a few years ago. The fit is good, but overall, these needed a better quality patina, one that could stand up to the movements of a training shoe. For £65, this really isn't acceptable.
Title: Peeling like a bad sunburn

Text:
These are excellent jeans. I've been looking for a new favourite everyday pair for a while now, and these tick all the boxes: Great colour and washing (a nice dark, classic blue, with just the right amount of washing to make your legs look great), not too low or too high at the waist, a good amount of stretch (they are described as jegging fit on the label), and a good length. I usually buy 30'' in length, but they were out and so I got the 32 instead, hoping that they wouldn't be too long and they aren't- I usually role up my jeans a bit anyway, no matter whether I am wearing ankle boots, or other flats. They also didn't come with the kind of smell that new jeans sometimes have- a sign of Hilfiger quality, I am sure. They are definitely on the tight side (for my usual 28), but I think that with some wearing they will loosen, due to the amount of elastan and how that reacts with body heat. 
All in all I can recommend them- well worth the money.
Title: The perfect jeans

Text: The first jacket that was delivered was the incorrect style and way too big so I returned the item.  I then ordered the item again that I initially wanted (in the hope that I would get the correct item) but ordered a smaller size as the incorrect style was way too big, the correct style  arrived but I should have got one size up.  Definitely a jacket that you have to try on before you buy as it is a tight fit, luckily I have long arms. So if you have a small frame body and long arms a size 38 would be fine, but I suggest if you have short arms, be sure that you are happy to role up the sleeves. I normally wear a UK size 12 jacket and a 38 (manufacturer size) is on the tight side.

Text:
These are amazing. They are very light and incredibly comfortable.  I climb around 5 times a week often straight from work and these are perfect to wear all day and used as an approach shoe to get to some of the climbs in North Wales.  They are as comfortable and sturdy as a hiking shoe and however they are not waterproof.  (not that I was expecting it).  The blue fabric is well aerated so they manage to keep my feet cool wearing them every day.

They also look well with jeans, not too shabby and not too smart.

I love these and am considering a second pair.
Title: Comfort, versatile and look good. What more do you need.

Text: Lovely jacket.  I am usually a size 8 but the 8 I ordered was too big.  The 6 fits better although the sleeves are slightly short. I was pleasantly surprised - its soft and quite authentic looking.  Its a good length too, longer than the usual biker jackets. The quilted design makes it interesting and I like the fact it doesn't have a collar as its less  fussy.  Very pleased with my purchase particularly the cost compared to if I had purchased it in store.  First time I have shopped with Zalando and it was a very positive experience.

Text:
I had been looking to replace an old pair of 17-yr old 'Engineer-style' biker boots for some years. I took my time to ensure that they were made by Harley-Davidson, so they would be fit for purpose (and not just look good).
After a long search I settled on these boots, as they were similar in style, well made, very comfortable, a reasonable price and with a full-length zip – a new and convenient feature.
However, on my first (12-day) ride around Europe it became apparent that the zip was not waterproof. The rain poured in, giving me damp socks every time it rained or we rode on wet roads. 
I cannot understand why anyone would design a 'proper' biker boot, put a zip in it and not ensure it was waterproofed. I have waterproof zips on my touring luggage and rubber gussets on my other (walking) boots, both of which have zero water ingress, so there's absolutely no excuse for such an oversight.
All in all, a very disappointing purchase.
Title: The Zip leaks!

Text:
I have never bought from Zalando before, and I am so glad I did! First of all, the shipping was fantastic. Not only was it free, but it took only two days to reach me. I ordered Tuesday evening and they arrived early Friday morning. Superb service. Secondly, the shoe is wonderful. I am a huge Jeffrey Campbell fan and was worried they would not be the same as the American JC's. However, the shoes are perfect, a lovely bright silver and the perfect size. Bear in mind if you havnt bought JC's before, they come up very large, so I bought the size four and I am usually a size 5. I always buy the four in JC's, so I recommend sizing down! One point to mention is that there is a slight loss of glitter on the shoes, but this is to be expected. Otherwise, I am so happy with the purchase and will be coming back to Zalando for more Jeffrey Campbells in the future. 

Excellent service, Excellent products, Excellent experience!
Title: Couldn't be happier!

Text:
My son was really excited at the prospect of getting a pair of these good looking football boots for his birthday.
When he got the boots he was over the moon as you would expect,but unfortunately that was very short lived as he wore the boots only once for a game and the front part of the sole had started to come away from the boot itself.
I contacted Zalando the moment we realised and the agent suggested I take some pictures of the boots and send into them which I did.
The next day I had an email to say they had no more in stock so I would have to accept a full refund or accept  £49.00 to have the faulty boots repaired which I have opted for as they suggested they had no more in stock.It has now come to my attention that they do have stock of these particular boots and I am now throughly disappointed as I would have chosen to exchange them as I didn't want to dissapointed my son any more than he was already.
Title: I am very disappointed with Zalando for not offering me the exchange option.

Text: Awful purchase. The heels snapped off just after the returns period ended and threw me headfirst down a long flight of tube station stairs. When I took them to a cobbler to have them repaired, he told me the inner part of the heel is oddly designed, with a hollow dip in the centre that stops the pins from holding the heel on. I asked him to try anyway, and sure enough they broke again shortly after. I am very light and was not running or putting any unusual pressure on the boot; they are simply not fit for sale. It's a huge shame, because the boots are otherwise stunningly beautiful - but if my gymnastics skills hadn't kicked in I might have broken my neck!
Title: Deathtrap!

Text: This product is actually quite nice. The material is matt in colour and is far from the shiny and noisy material used in parka's. The colour is actually quite a nice blue especially for winter. The coat also is warm. It just isn't waterproof. The biggest fault with this product is that the sleeves are a bit short. It is a winter coat/parka, so the sleeves should be a bit to accommodate the covering of the wrists so that the hands and wrists don't get cold. If the sleeves on this coat were an even an inch longer, it would have made all the difference. However I really needed a coat last minute and for that reason I can't return it. If I had time to buy a coat I would return it in order to find something with longer sleeves. However I am stuck with it. Please please just make coat sleeves a little longer on regular sized clothing.
Title: Sleeves come up short - wrists get very cold.

I bought these boots because they looked comfy and warm. I like the colour and quality of the leather but these boots are far too wide and bulky. They also did not fit because they were far to narrow for my toes (and I have slim feet). 
If you like bulky boots that look like builders boots, then buy one size larger than your normal shoe size. I would say the third photo is the most accurate but the boots I received were more pointy on the toes.

Text: Would definitely say the XL and XXL sizes of this jacket are meant for taller people rather than broader people. I'm a chunky guy (5'10'', 42w) yet it still felt massive on me and the proportions were off. For instance, the sleeves either had to pinch under my arms or they were too long, but the back and shoulders were ok, and it had more of a slim/straight-fit to it than a regular fit. It was tight to zip up but the material is so thick that it looked like I was wearing 5 layers (even with my bear belly!). The length is just about ok for my height but I could still feel that it was meant to sit higher up - the pockets were at a comfortable height for my hands to rest in but the collar didn't line up with my neck. And then there's the hood, the most hilariously-massive hood I've ever seen. You could get three heads in there, never mind one. If it sits all the way back on your head, it feels like you're in a tunnel. I'm sure this design would look great on the right people but, sadly, it just doesn't suit me, which is a real shame as I had it on my wishlist for months before it finally came down in price in a sale and I could use my introductory voucher code too. So, have given it a 4-star rating. It's a great jacket and one of the most appealing designs I've seen in years, but frustratingly not for my build
Title: Great if you've got the right build...

Text:
It's understated design is comfortable, light weight, warm and practical. I am in love with the colour. It really appears to be very well made too. I can see it lasting a long time. One of those everyday things that feels really special. 

There's five pockets, and one is internal. The sides that come down are not only a nice design feature, they also have drawstrings on the inside so the bottom can be closer to your body in the cold if needed. 

 I got a medium and it's super roomy. I'm Uk size 10/12 and I think I would fit a small but I love that it can accommodate bulky clothing. 

Thanks Zalando - I couldn't be happier!!
Title: Little bit of a gem
